text:
Never used it my self but found this on stack overflow

_Until the market is actually closed, the starting price can only be estimated, and Betfair have two methods for this, the *far price* and the *near price*._

<https://sports.stackexchange.com/questions/10697/how-to-calculate-the-far-and-near-price-of-betfair>

attachments.fallback: Sports Stack Exchange: How to calculate the far and near price of betfair?

text: The above are the logs from adapting the strategy so that it will place a £2 back bet at the best available price on the first runner (as ranked by runner id). The market only has to be 'OPEN' not in play.  Its filtered for the <https://www.betfair.com/exchange/plus/horse-racing/market/1.208749303?nodeId=32033309|Wolves 15:15> market on the 18th.
